title: Cher, O2 Arena, review: an extravagantly entertaining evening with a 73-year-old superstar
text:
“What is your granny doing tonight?” Cher teasingly enquired at the start of an extravagantly entertaining show. I think it is fair to say that unless you are a direct descendent of the 73-year-old American superstar, your elderly relatives are unlikely to have been up to anything like this.

Backed by a slick seven-piece band and 10 dancers, Cher paraded around in skimpy clothing and ludicrous wigs, sang duets with her dead ex-husband, rode an animatronic elephant, cavorted with muscular gladiators and spanked lithe Burlesque dancers, gossiped about life in Hollywood and belted her lungs out on a succession of crowd-pleasing hits, all choreographed with a flamboyancy that could make Strictly...
